Abstract: Grasp learning is a pivotal area in robotics, focusing on the development of models and methods to enhance robotic manipulation capabilities. This study reviews recent advancements in machine learning techniques applied to grasping tasks, highlighting the integration of deep learning and reinforcement learning frameworks. We analyze the performance of various models in diverse manipulation scenarios, emphasizing the role of data-driven approaches in improving grasp success rates. The paper also discusses challenges such as generalization across different objects and environments, proposing future directions for research to achieve more robust and adaptive grasping solutions.
